child.tree-val: Lower Fungom Languages: Good et al 2012
child.pub-comments: The authors have proposed the use of beboid in place of Eastern Beboid since Beboid would no longer be associated with a Western Beboid group (which has been renamed Yemne-Kimbi).

child.tree-val: Lower Fungom Languages: Good et al 2012
child.geography: Spoken in Mekaf and Small Mekaf villages as well as Mashi Overside.

child.tree-val: Lower Fungom Languages: Good et al 2012
child.pub-comments: The authors are not so sure of this dialect. In their words: "Mashi appears to speak a distinct variety of Naki - or at least avariety distinct from that of Mekaf …".

The Languages of the Lower Fungom Region of Cameroon: Grammatical Overview, Africana Linguistica, vol. XVII, 101-164. Tervuren, Belgium.: Tervuren’s African Linguistics department in collaboration with Peeters Publishers, Leuven, Belgium.

child.tree-val: Lower Fungom Languages: Good et al 2012
child.pub-comments: In place of Western beboid, the authors have proposed the name, Yemne-Kimbi for these group of languages which reference two rivers that are found at the western and eastern borders of the Lower Fungom region, between which all of the relevant languages are spoken.

child.tree-val: Lower Fungom Languages: Good et al 2012
child.geography: Spoken in Biya, Munken, Ngun, Missong and Abar villages.

child.tree-val: Lower Fungom Languages: Good et al 2012
child.pub-comments: The authors are not so sure of this dialect. In their words: "…it seems probable that the linguistic variety spoken in Buu is a distinct, though closely related, language from the varieties spoken in Mundabli and Mufu. The same is also probably true of the linguistic variety of Missong as compared to the other four Mungbam villages."
child.publications: Di Carlo, Pierpaolo , Jeff Good, Jesse Lovegren, Jean Patrick Mve, Carine Nganguep Tchiemouo & Rebecca Voll. 2011. Tervuren, Belgium.: Tervuren’s African Linguistics department in collaboration with Peeters Publishers, Leuven, Belgium.

child.geography: Spoken in Buu, Mufu abd Mundabli villages.
